question: Canada election called by midnight?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) projects a party to form a majority or minority government in the 2025 Canadian federal election by April 28, 2025, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution of this market will be based on the first official projection of a majority or minority government made by the CBC during its election coverage, regardless of whether they later revise that projection.

The resolution source for this market will be official information from the CBC, including its broadcast, website (CBCNews.ca), or official social media accounts.

question: Will Donald Trump sign an executive order on April 28?
description:
This market will resolve "Yes" if Donald Trump signs an executive order on the listed date. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Executive actions will not qualify toward this market’s resolution.

This market will immediately resolve "Yes" if the text of an executive order for the given day is published on the White House page for presidential actions (https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/) or the White House press pool. Mere announcements will not qualify.

question: Will Deshaun Watson start Week 1 for the Browns?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if the listed player is the starting quarterback for the Cleveland Browns in their Week 1 regular season game of the 2025 NFL season. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.”

If the Browns do not name a single player as the starting quarterback, the market will resolve based on the player who takes the most snaps at quarterback during their first offensive drive of the game. If multiple players take the same number of snaps on the Browns’ first offensive drive, the market will resolve to the player who took the first snap at quarterback.

This market may not resolve before the start of the Browns Week 1 regular season game. 

The resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.

question: Will Trump congratulate Canada election winner by Tuesday?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump publicly congratulates the winner of the 2025 Canadian federal election by Tuesday, April 29, 2025, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

A congratulatory message must clearly reference the winner, (either the party or presumptive Prime Minister) and express congratulations. Any congratulatory message to the presumed winner of the Canadian election will qualify regardless of if/when the results of the election are finalized.

Only announcements made directly by Donald Trump himself, official statements from the White House explicitly on behalf of Trump, or posts from Trump's official social media accounts will qualify. 

Statements from the State Department, or from administration officials will not qualify.

The resolution source will be official announcements from Trump, however a consensus for credible reporting may also be used.

question: Will 'Thunderbolts' gross less than $67m on opening weekend?
description:
This market will resolve according to how much “Thunderbolts” (2025) will gross domestically on its opening weekend. The “Box Office” https://www.the-numbers.com/movie/Thunderbolts-(2025)#tab=summary will be used to resolve this market once the values for the 3-day opening weekend (May 2 - May 4) are final (i.e. not studio estimates).

If the reported value falls exactly between two brackets, then this market will resolve to the higher range bracket.

Please note, this market will resolve according to the The Numbers figures provided under Weekend Box Office Performance for the 3-day weekend (which typically includes Thursday's previews), regardless of whether domestic refers to only the USA, or to USA and Canada, etc.

If there is no final data available by May 12, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, another credible resolution source will be chosen.

question: Record low border encounters in April?
description:
In February 2025 (FYTD) there were 28,654 border encounters, the lowest on record (see: https://www.cbp.gov/newsroom/stats/nationwide-encounters)

This market will resolve to "Yes" if there are less than 28,654 for April 2025 (FYTD). Otherwise this market will resolve to "No".

This market will resolve based on the first report of data for April 2025, regardless of future revisions. If no data is posted for April 2025 (FYTD) by July 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source is United States Customs and Border Protection (see: https://www.cbp.gov/newsroom/stats/nationwide-encounters)

question: Bitcoin Up or Down on April 30?
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the "Close" price for the Binance 1 minute candle for BTCUSDT 29 Apr 12:00 in the ET timezone (noon) is lower than the final "Close" price for the 30 Apr 12:00 ET candle.
This market will resolve to "Down" if the "Close" price for the Binance 1 minute candle for BTCUSDT 29 Apr 12:00 in the ET timezone (noon) is higher than the final "Close" price for the 30 Apr 12:00 ET candle.
If the final "Close" price for both of these candles is exactly equal on Binance, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source for this market is Binance, specifically the BTCUSDT "Close" prices currently available at https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT with "1m" and "Candles" selected on the top bar.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTCUSDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Will the highest temperature in London be 72°F or below on April 30?
description:
This market will resolve to the temperature range that contains the highest temperature recorded at the London City Airport Station in degrees Fahrenheit on April 30, 2025.

The resolution source for this market will be information from Wunderground, specifically the highest temperature recorded for all times on this day by the Forecast for the London City Airport Station once information is finalized, available here: https://www.wunderground.com/history/daily/gb/london/EGLC.

This market can not resolve to "Yes" until all data for this date has been finalized.

The resolution source for this market measures temperatures to whole degrees Fahrenheit (eg, 21°F). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market.

Any revisions to temperatures recorded after data is finalized for this market’s timeframe will not be considered for this market's resolution.

question: Largest pot of all time on 2025 Hustler Casino Million Dollar Game?
description:

question: Will U.S. summer tourism decline in 2025?
description:
There were 15,965,529 foreign arrivals in Summer 2024 (June: 4,695,670, July: 5,519,399, August: 5,750,460) according to U.S. International Air Travel Statistics. (see: https://www.trade.gov/us-international-air-travel-statistics-i-92-data)

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the total visitors to the U.S. for Summer 2025 is less than 15,965,529. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market will be U.S. International Air Travel Statistics (I-92 data), specifically, the value associated with "Foreign Originating" for June, July and August 2025 under "Monthly Data" at https://www.trade.gov/us-international-air-travel-statistics-i-92-data.  If the data for the listed months is not available, by December 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

question: Canadiens vs. Capitals
description:
In the upcoming NHL game, scheduled for April 30 at 7:00PM ET:
If the Montreal Canadiens win, the market will resolve to “Canadiens”.
If the Washington Capitals win, the market will resolve to “Capitals”.
If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.
If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.
